p: The heat shock protein, HSP90B, was found overexpressed and associated with aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AHR; 3.68E00) and xenobiotic metabolism (2.84E00) pathways. HSP90B commonly acts as a chaperone molecule facilitating the proper folding of proteins in ATP-dependent reactions. This protein is also induced upon stress and xenobiotic exposure [ 55]. HSP90B also forms associations with AHR’s and glucocorticoid receptors, which bind foreign compounds, including steroids [ 56]. Furthermore, AHR’s may interact with a number of xenobiotic-binding proteins such as steroid receptors [ 56] and cytochrome P450, which also metabolize androgens [ 57], estrogens [ 58] and AAS [ 59].
